newsitem.title: GERMANY: Rexrodt says Germany firmly against delaying EMU.
newsitem.headline: Rexrodt says Germany firmly against delaying EMU.

text.p: Economics Minister Guenter Rexrodt told parliament on Thursday that Germany was firmly against any delay in the launch of Europe's economic and monetary union (EMU).
"The euro is needed on time if we do not want to damage the single market," he said.
Rexrodt was speaking in a debate on the single currency called by the opposition Social Democrats.
"If the euro were delayed, it would be a delay for a long term," he said.

Fincance Minister Theo Waigel said at the beginning of the debate that he would oppose any weakening of the Maastricht criteria, which say EMU members should have budget deficits of three percent or less of gross domestic product and overall debt levels of 60 percent of GDP or less.
